TextView.android:text: Since the disability of each child is different, a customised education plan or Individualised Education Plan (IEP) is carefully devised for each child. Muskan Foundation provides Special Education Services to children (age group 0-18), maintaining a 1:3 teacher-child ratio, to provide comprehensive services under one roof. We also provide 1:1 teacher-child service in case of severe disabilities. We work to develop the child’s cognitive, motor, communication, recreational and daily living skills.

In order to develop a comprehensive and sustainable response to children, Desire Society has initiated a project which is committed to provide services of treatment, nutrition, shelter and education with moral support to Children Living with HIV/AIDS(CLHA).

Considering the fact that eye diseases are more prevalent among economically underprivileged and impoverished communities in India, the Department initiated in Mumbai, projects to detect and treat glaucoma, cataract and conjunctivitis and provide medication and spectacles to children living in the slums and those attending municipal schools; and the disadvantaged adult population. Our trained staff conducts eye examination of the target groups with state-of-the-art ophthalmic equipment. Complex cases are referred to ophthalmic specialists for appropriate treatment – including surgery. This service is cost-free and happens in alliance with a vast network of ophthalmologists, hospitals and the Mumbai Municipal Corporation. So far, the Department has screened eyes of 5,04,577 children and 1,03,825 adults.

We provide elders relief through various interventions such as – we run one of the largest mobile healthcare programs through our Mobile Healthcare Units spanning the country providing free healthcare services to destitute elders and serve care for old people, we help elders become self-reliant and independent through the formation of Elder-Self-Help Groups, conduct cataract surgeries to restore their sight, look after their basic needs through our Support-a-Gran program, run Elder Helplines across the country, provide relief and rehabilitation for elders post disasters and provide Active Ageing opportunities and ensure caring for elderly.

Our vision turned out to be a change by moving over a newly profound and technological environment who is deaf and silent. Wearing out the pain of their silence and pushing them to be a part of their society by providing them the donated mobile phones. The heading of making them aware of the technology and making them confident enough to endure and compete with the world. Being awarded with the world education summit award 2013 the vision has become clearer.

The ERC supports the education of people with vision impairment by providing them accessible reading material. “Accessible Reading Material” means books in the form of eText, ePub, DAISY (audio), mp3 and Braille formats.
Global vision has taken an initiative to educate people at large to fight against cancer.

Our Project Dostana covers a population of more than 2500 MSM individuals and has a Drop-in-Centre and Clinic located in Kandivali covering sites from Dahisar to Mumbai Central. The project organizes weekly community events on Saturday and also holds free STI check-ups and HIV testing camps.

Sanket Foundation provides education services through “First Steps” to deaf and hard of hearing children, with aims to lay foundation of success for later years. It provides Early Childhood Development Programme for ages birth-6 years, to give to give them language and to prepare them with skills to be ready for school.

Our aim is to prevent HIV transmission and control its spread. It is to reduce the adverse social and economic impact resulting from HIV infection. we are also there to coordinate and strengthen STD/HIV/AIDS surveillance.

The main aim of our program is to make the events, spaces and its artworks more welcoming and accessible to the visually impaired visitors along with others with special needs so that one goes back with a fulfilling experience. There were tactile maps, braille books, tactile reproductions of art works on display, tactile and braille equipped signage.

We provide Funds to patients who are taking treatment at Private hospitals and who fall under the middle income group. The help ranges anywhere between Rs. 20,000/- to Rs. 50,000/- (sometimes even more). Patients who are getting treated in Mumbai from any private hospitals, and also the private patients from Tata Memorial Hospital receive this help.
